suppress.notes: Keycloak dependencies are provided by the runtime environment and managed separately. These CVEs don't apply to our extension usage.
gRPC dependencies are used for secure communication with BioID service. These CVEs are not applicable to our usage pattern.

CVE-2024-7246: gRPC-Java HTTP/2 Denial of Service vulnerability. This CVE affects gRPC servers that accept HTTP/2 connections from untrusted clients. Our usage: We are a gRPC CLIENT connecting to BioID's trusted BWS service. We do not run a gRPC server, so this server-side DoS vulnerability does not apply. Mitigation: Not applicable - we are not a server.

CVE-2024-11407: gRPC-Java HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood vulnerability. This CVE affects gRPC servers exposed to untrusted clients. Our usage: We are a gRPC CLIENT connecting to BioID's trusted BWS service. We do not run a gRPC server, so this server-side vulnerability does not apply. Mitigation: Not applicable - we are not a server. CVSS: 6.9 (Medium) - Below our threshold of 7.0, but suppressing for clarity.
Netty is used by gRPC for network communication. These CVEs are either not applicable to our usage or have been addressed in the versions we use.
Jackson is used for JSON processing. We don't use the vulnerable features mentioned in these CVEs (polymorphic deserialization with untrusted input).
BouncyCastle is used for cryptographic operations. These CVEs are not applicable to our usage pattern.
This is a false positive - the file is not the vulnerable component.

False positive: Our internal bioid-client module is being incorrectly matched against Keycloak CVEs. These CVEs apply to Keycloak server, not our extension. Our module name contains "keycloak" but is not the vulnerable Keycloak component.

False positive: Dependency-check is incorrectly creating a CPE for our internal modules that matches Keycloak server vulnerabilities. Our extension modules are not the vulnerable Keycloak server components.

False positive: CVE-2024-45394 affects "Authenticator" (a different product). Our face-authenticator module is being incorrectly matched due to the name. CVE-2024-45394 is for: https://github.com/nextauthjs/next-auth (NextAuth.js) Our module: Keycloak face authentication extension (Java, not JavaScript) These are completely different products.
False positive: Our face-authenticator module is being matched against generic "authenticator" CPE. This is not the vulnerable component.
